thread.title: Nets owner dreams of President Obama and Putin coming to a game
thread.title_full: Nets owner dreams of President Obama and Putin coming to a game

title: Nets owner dreams of President Obama and Putin coming to a game
text:
Nets owner dreams of President Obama and Putin coming to a game FOX Sports 
Oct 14, 2015 at 8:41p ET + Jim O'Connor / USA TODAY Sports FOX Sports Updated Oct 14, 2015 at 8:41p ET 
Nets owner Mikhail Prokhorov isn't just trying to build a basketball team. He's also attempting to complete some of the boldest goals any person can have: accomplishing world peace. 
At the least, he'd have to make sure some countries' international relations were far more diplomatic than they are now to turn his team into a reality. And what's Prokhorov's dream? Why don't we let him tell you. 
From an interview he recently did with GQ : Q: Do you think you could beat Putin in a game of 1-on-1? What about Obama? A: I would prefer to have both of them join me in my box rooting for the same team, the Brooklyn Nets. Thatâ€™s kind of a dream of mine. 
I'll tell you this much: If Obama and Putin came to Barclays Center and were rooting for Prokhorov's team, the biggest news of the night would be that people were actually cheering for the Nets at a Nets game. MORE NEWS: Want stories delivered to you? Sign up for our NBA newsletters.
